\\/D:\\/repos\\/stride-translations\\/pt: To create <g1>ribbons<\/g1> and <g2>trails<\/g2>, Stride builds the mesh data as a strip connecting the particles, rather than individual quads.
Para criar <g1>ribbons<\/g1> e <g2>trails<\/g2>, Stride constrói os dados de malha como uma faixa que liga as partículas, em vez de quads individuais.
To create <g1>ribbons<\/g1> and <g2>trails<\/g2>, Stride builds the mesh data as a strip connecting the particles, rather than individual quads.
Ribbons and trails are often used to create visual effects such as sword slashes.
As fitas e as trilhas são frequentemente usadas para criar efeitos visuais, como escórias de espada.
Ribbons and trails are often used to create visual effects such as sword slashes.
In the diagram below, several particles (represented as red dots) are rendered as individual quads (blue squares):
No diagrama abaixo, várias partículas (representadas como pontos vermelhos) são renderizadas como quads individuais (quadrados azuis):
In the diagram below, several particles (represented as red dots) are rendered as individual quads (blue squares):
In the diagram below, a strip is created by connecting the particles and rendering quads between the adjacent particles:
No diagrama abaixo, uma tira é criada conectando as partículas e tornando quads entre as partículas adjacentes:
In the diagram below, a strip is created by connecting the particles and rendering quads between the adjacent particles:
Both ribbons and trails generate a flat surface which follows an axis connecting adjacent particles in a line.
Ambas as fitas e trilhas geram uma superfície plana que segue um eixo conectando partículas adjacentes em uma linha.
Both ribbons and trails generate a flat surface which follows an axis connecting adjacent particles in a line.
This line defines one of the axes of the surface.
Esta linha define um dos eixos da superfície.
This line defines one of the axes of the surface.
The difference is that ribbons always face the camera, and trails don't.
A diferença é que as fitas sempre enfrentam a câmera, e as trilhas não.
The difference is that ribbons always face the camera, and trails don't.
The gif below shows the different behavior of ribbons (red) and trails (yellow) when viewed from different camera angles.
O gif abaixo mostra o comportamento diferente de fitas (vermelho) e trilhas (amarelo) quando visto de diferentes ângulos de câmera.
The gif below shows the different behavior of ribbons (red) and trails (yellow) when viewed from different camera angles.
Note how the ribbon doesn't change as the camera moves; it's fixed in space.
Observe como a fita não muda à medida que a câmera se move; ela é fixa no espaço.
Note how the ribbon doesn't change as the camera moves; it's fixed in space.
To create ribbons and trails, you usually need to sort the particles into an order.
Para criar fitas e trilhas, você geralmente precisa classificar as partículas em uma ordem.
To create ribbons and trails, you usually need to sort the particles into an order.
If you don't sort the particles, they connect erratically, as in this diagram:
Se você não classificar as partículas, elas se conectam erraticamente, como neste diagrama:
If you don't sort the particles, they connect erratically, as in this diagram:
Here's an example of how unsorted particles look at runtime:
Aqui está um exemplo de como as partículas não ousadas olham para o tempo de execução:
Here's an example of how unsorted particles look at runtime:
Rather than the particles connecting in order, the strip erratically jumps between particles.
Em vez das partículas que se conectam em ordem, a tira erraticamente salta entre partículas.
Rather than the particles connecting in order, the strip erratically jumps between particles.
(This is the same problem alpha-blended quads have when they're not properly sorted.)
(Este é o mesmo problema que os quads alfa-blended têm quando eles não são classificados corretamente.)
(This is the same problem alpha-blended quads have when they're not properly sorted.)
To sort the particles, under <g1>Particle System > Source > Emitters<\/g1>, change the <g2>Sorting<\/g2> property.
Para classificar as partículas, sob <g1>Particle System > Source > Emitters<\/g1>, altere a propriedade <g2>Sorting<\/g2>.
To sort the particles, under <g1>Particle System > Source > Emitters<\/g1>, change the <g2>Sorting<\/g2> property.
If your particles have the same <g1>lifespan<\/g1> property, and are emitted no more than once per frame (usually the case at 30 particles per second or fewer), you can sort them by age.

Se suas partículas têm a mesma propriedade <g1>lifespan<\/g1>, e são emitidas não mais do que uma vez por quadro (geralmente o caso em 30 partículas por segundo ou menos), você pode classificá-las por idade.
If your particles have the same <g1>lifespan<\/g1> property, and are emitted no more than once per frame (usually the case at 30 particles per second or fewer), you can sort them by age.
However, if you spawn several particles per second or your particles vary in lifespan, sorting by age doesn't provide a consistent order, as the sorting parameter changes between frames.

No entanto, se você gerou várias partículas por segundo ou suas partículas variam em vida útil, a classificação por idade não fornece uma ordem consistente, pois o parâmetro de classificação muda entre quadros.
However, if you spawn several particles per second or your particles vary in lifespan, sorting by age doesn't provide a consistent order, as the sorting parameter changes between frames.
In this case, you should sort the particles by order.
Neste caso, você deve classificar as partículas por ordem.
In this case, you should sort the particles by order.
To do this, you need to add a <g1>spawn order initializer<\/g1>.
Para fazer isso, você precisa adicionar um inicializador de ordem <g1>spawn<\/g1>.
To do this, you need to add a <g1>spawn order initializer<\/g1>.

To do this, in the entity properties, under <g2>Particle System > Source > Emitters<\/g2>, next to <g3>Initializers<\/g3>, click <x1\/>Green plus button<x2\/> (<g4>Add<\/g4>) and select <g5>Spawn Order<\/g5>.

Para fazer isso, nas propriedades da entidade, sob <g2>Particle System > Source > Emitters<\/g2>, ao lado de <g3>Initializers<\/g3>, clique em <x1\/>Green plus button<x2\/> (<g4>Add<\/g4>Spawn Order<\/g5>.

To do this, in the entity properties, under <g2>Particle System > Source > Emitters<\/g2>, next to <g3>Initializers<\/g3>, click <x1\/>Green plus button<x2\/> (<g4>Add<\/g4>) and select <g5>Spawn Order<\/g5>.
This adds a spawn order initializer to the emitter.
Isso adiciona um inicializador de ordem espawn ao emissor.
This adds a spawn order initializer to the emitter.
It doesn't have any properties, but it gives the particles a SpawnID we can sort them by.
Não tem propriedades, mas dá às partículas um SpawnID que podemos classificá-las.
It doesn't have any properties, but it gives the particles a SpawnID we can sort them by.
Sorting by depth might work in niche cases, but this doesn't preserve the order between different frames.
A classificação por profundidade pode funcionar em casos de nicho, mas isso não preserva a ordem entre diferentes quadros.
Sorting by depth might work in niche cases, but this doesn't preserve the order between different frames.
We don't recommend it for most situations.
Não o recomendamos para a maioria das situações.
We don't recommend it for most situations.
Unlike billboards, which are individual quads, ribbons and trails have a single surface across all particles.
Ao contrário de outdoors, que são quads individuais, fitas e trilhas têm uma única superfície em todas as partículas.
Unlike billboards, which are individual quads, ribbons and trails have a single surface across all particles.
To define how textures are mapped across the surface, under <g1>Particle System > Source > Emitters > Shape<\/g1>, change the <g2>UV Coords<\/g2> property.
Para definir como as texturas são mapeadas através da superfície, abaixo de <g1>Particle System > Source > Emitters > Shape<\/g1>, altere a propriedade <g2>UV Coords<\/g2>.
To define how textures are mapped across the surface, under <g1>Particle System > Source > Emitters > Shape<\/g1>, change the <g2>UV Coords<\/g2> property.
The texture is mapped per segment, copying the same quad stretched between every two particles.
A textura é mapeada por segmento, copiando o mesmo quad esticado entre cada duas partículas.
The texture is mapped per segment, copying the same quad stretched between every two particles.
This is sometimes useful with flipbook animations (in the <g2>Material<\/g2> settings).
Isso às vezes é útil com animações flipbook (nas configurações <g2>Material<\/g2>).
This is sometimes useful with flipbook animations (in the <g2>Material<\/g2> settings).
The texture is stretched between the first and last particle of the trail or ribbon.
A textura é esticada entre a primeira e última partícula da trilha ou fita.
The texture is stretched between the first and last particle of the trail or ribbon.
The <g2>UV Factor<\/g2> defines how many times the texture appears across the entire trail or ribbon (1 = once).
O <g2>UV Factor<\/g2> define quantas vezes a textura aparece em toda a trilha ou fita (1 = uma vez).
The <g2>UV Factor<\/g2> defines how many times the texture appears across the entire trail or ribbon (1 = once).
The texture is repeated based on the actual world length of the ribbon or trail rather than the number of particles.
A textura é repetida com base no comprimento do mundo real da fita ou da trilha em vez do número de partículas.
The texture is repeated based on the actual world length of the ribbon or trail rather than the number of particles.
The <g2>UV Factor<\/g2> defines the distance in <g3>world units<\/g3> after which the texture repeats
O <g2>UV Factor<\/g2> define a distância em unidades <g3>world<\/g3> após o qual a textura repete
The <g2>UV Factor<\/g2> defines the distance in <g3>world units<\/g3> after which the texture repeats
<x1\/> Mapeamento de textura baseado em resistência<x2\/>
You can add extra segments between adjacent particles to smooth the lines between particles.
Você pode adicionar segmentos extras entre partículas adjacentes para alisar as linhas entre partículas.
You can add extra segments between adjacent particles to smooth the lines between particles.
To do this, under <g1>Particle System > Source > Emitters > Shape<\/g1>, change the <g2>Smoothing<\/g2> property.
Para fazer isso, sob <g1>Particle System > Source > Emitters > Shape<\/g1>, altere a propriedade <g2>Smoothing<\/g2>.
To do this, under <g1>Particle System > Source > Emitters > Shape<\/g1>, change the <g2>Smoothing<\/g2> property.
<g1>None<\/g1> — No smoothing creates only one segment joining two particles.
<g1>None<\/g1> — Nenhum alisamento cria apenas um segmento juntando duas partículas.
<g1>None<\/g1> — No smoothing creates only one segment joining two particles.
This creates trails and ribbons with sharp angles.
Isso cria trilhas e fitas com ângulos afiados.
This creates trails and ribbons with sharp angles.
<g1>Fast<\/g1> — This uses <g2>Catmull-Rom interpolation (Wikipedia)<\/g2> to add extra segments between particles, creating a smoother effect.
<g1>Fast<\/g1> — Isso usa a interpolação <g2>Catmull-Rom (Wikipedia)<\/g2> para adicionar segmentos extras entre partículas, criando um efeito mais suave.
<g1>Fast<\/g1> — This uses <g2>Catmull-Rom interpolation (Wikipedia)<\/g2> to add extra segments between particles, creating a smoother effect.
You can set the number of segments with the <g3>Segments<\/g3> property.
Você pode definir o número de segmentos com a propriedade <g3>Segmentos<\/g3>.
You can set the number of segments with the <g3>Segments<\/g3> property.
<g1>Best<\/g1> — This generally creates the smoothest effect, but requires more CPU.
<g1>Best<\/g1> — Isso geralmente cria o efeito mais suave, mas requer mais CPU.
<g1>Best<\/g1> — This generally creates the smoothest effect, but requires more CPU.
It calculates a circumcircle around every three sequential particles along the control axis, then adds extra control points on the circle, keeping the segments in an arc.
Ele calcula um círculo em torno de cada três partículas sequenciais ao longo do eixo de controle, em seguida, adiciona pontos de controle extras no círculo, mantendo os segmentos em um arco.
It calculates a circumcircle around every three sequential particles along the control axis, then adds extra control points on the circle, keeping the segments in an arc.

For the first and the last segment, there is only one arc to be followed, but for mid-sections, two different arcs from two different circles overlap; Stride interpolates the control points from the first arc and the second as the point approaches the second particle.

Para o primeiro e último segmento, há apenas um arco a ser seguido, mas para as secções médias, dois arcos diferentes de dois círculos diferentes se sobrepõem; Stride interpola os pontos de controle do primeiro arco e o segundo como o ponto aproxima a segunda partícula.

For the first and the last segment, there is only one arc to be followed, but for mid-sections, two different arcs from two different circles overlap; Stride interpolates the control points from the first arc and the second as the point approaches the second particle.
You can set the number of segments between every two particles with the <g2>Segments<\/g2> property.
Você pode definir o número de segmentos entre cada duas partículas com a propriedade <g2>Segmentos<\/g2>.
You can set the number of segments between every two particles with the <g2>Segments<\/g2> property.
This video shows the difference between the three smoothing methods.
Este vídeo mostra a diferença entre os três métodos de alisamento.
This video shows the difference between the three smoothing methods.
Note that the rightmost trail (using the <g1>Best<\/g1> method) is slightly more circular, closer to the actual path of the sword swing.
Note que a trilha mais correta (usando o método <g1>Best<\/g1>) é ligeiramente mais circular, mais próxima do caminho real do balanço da espada.
Note that the rightmost trail (using the <g1>Best<\/g1> method) is slightly more circular, closer to the actual path of the sword swing.
For an example of a project that uses ribbons and trails, try the <g1>Ribbon Particles Sample<\/g1> included with Stride.
Para um exemplo de um projeto que usa fitas e trilhas, experimente o <g1>Ribbon Particles Sample<\/g1> incluído com Stride.
For an example of a project that uses ribbons and trails, try the <g1>Ribbon Particles Sample<\/g1> included with Stride.
